intro: Antennaria denikeana, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf morphology. The plant features dense, woolly foliage that helps insulate it from harsh alpine conditions. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in small, clustered inflorescences. Antennaria denikeana is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, thriving in environments with strong sunlight and cold temperatures.
